isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB TILTING PROCEDURE - CHECKING AND FILLING HYDRAULIC SYSTEM

svcproc.title: CHECKING AND FILLING HYDRAULIC SYSTEM
svcproc.para: Locate filler plug on lift pump reservoir ( Figure 8). Remove and check fluid level with the cab in the down position (to prevent overfilling). Oil should be up to the bottom of the filler plug well. Fill as required with Dexron Automatic Transmission Fluid. DO NOT USE BRAKE FLUID.

If the cab lift pump is repaired or replaced prior to connecting the hoses, it should be filled with oil and while the RAISE- LOWER lever is in each position, stroke the pump to purge all of the air from the pump. After installation of the pump assembly, check the pump operation. The hydraulic lift system will have to be bled.

caution.para: Do not refill reservoir with cab in raised position.
